description: Has nice features but is missing Sunday and Monday. Seems to be stuck on the same day.
If you switch the time format to 12h mode in the settings it breaks the app and it wont load weather information.
Options for various messurement types, and making sure the display adapts to different window sizes would be great improvements, the icon is very pretty, and the overal ui design is a great start
summary: Pretty, but needs a little more work

description: doesn't even get past the first screen
summary: doesn't even get past the first screen

description:
1) It couldn't find my home town without the acute (á) which is a big design flaw.
2) There are multiple choices for Budapest (?????)
3) When I selected either one, nothing actually happened.
4) UI looks consistent with the GNOME desktop environment.
does not get past the first screen

It does seem to get stuck at the first screen, but once you select a city from the limited choices, you just close that window then open the program again it will show the city you selected.
Cons:
- There is no imperial measurement option
- The time is 24-hour/military only
- The forecast is only for the next 24 hours
- No detailed weather options (radar)
- City search only shows the country and lat/long, no state or province (there are many MANY cities in the US with the same name, even with similar latitude and longitude, and you can't type your latitude and longitude, only city name)
summary: Simple, pretty app with limited usability
does what i need it to

description: Changed to Forecast app, because weather app stopped working. This app was easy to install and setup for my location and so far works flawlessly!
summary: Works great, was using one called Weather and it stopped working

description: Presents a screen with a text input box and a prompt to search city. But, there's no button to start search, and enter key does nothing. So it simply sits there. But, close it and open again, and now it _does_ present a dropdown. Next, setting units dialog has no confirmation button, the window close button. The units in the main window do not change, but close and reopen, and maybe it did change.
It seems to think it is tomorrow. Give's me tomorrows forecast as current conditions.
This weather app is the best I've seen for Gnome. It integrates well within the Gnome UI and works just as expected.

Enfin une application météo agréable à regarder me permettant de choisir un lieu précis plutôt que la capitale de mon pays comme sous l'application météo officielle de GNOME ce qui ne me permettait pas d'avoir les bonnes valeurs.
